2018-07-22T14:59:06Z: Hamilton looks up at the Union Jack and waves his finger as the British national anthem rings out.
2018-07-22T14:58:05Z: The rain is hammering down now as the podium ceremony begins.
2018-07-22T14:56:28Z: Hamilton is embraced by Mercedes chairman Dieter Zetsche, who congratulates his man on a brilliant victory.
2018-07-22T14:54:36Z: “It’s obviously highly unlikely from that position - but you’ve always got to believe. The team did a fantastic job today. I’m so grateful. Hopefully this solidifies be belief. For those who don’t know me, now they do”- @LewisHamilton  👊#F1 #GermanGP
2018-07-22T14:48:55Z: German GP finishing order: 1 Hamilton, 2 Bottas, 3 Raikkonen, 4 Verstappen, 5 Hulkenberg, 6 Grosjean, 7 Perez, 8 Ocon, 9 Ericsson, 10 Hartley, 11 Magnussen, 12 Sainz, 13 Vandoorne, 14 Gasly, 15 Leclerc, 16 Alonso (not running at finish). Retired: Stroll, Vettel, Sirotkin, Ricciardo.
2018-07-22T14:46:50Z: Hamilton is only the 12th driver to win a world championship grand prix after starting 14th or lower.
2018-07-22T14:46:38Z: Hulkenberg takes fifth. Grosjean nabs sixth from Perez on the last lap!
2018-07-22T14:46:06Z: It's a Mercedes 1-2, with Bottas second, while Raikkonen holds onto the final podium spot ahead of Max Verstappen.
2018-07-22T14:45:46Z: Lewis Hamilton wins the German Grand Prix from 14th on the grid!
2018-07-22T14:44:52Z: Grosjean's charge continues. He picks off Ocon and is up to seventh now.
2018-07-22T14:44:41Z: Hamilton starts that final lap with another blistering fastest lap - 1m15.5s. He's 3.9s clear of Bottas.
2018-07-22T14:43:39Z: Lap 66/67: 1 Hamilton, 2 Bottas, 3 Raikkonen, 4 Verstappen, 5 Hulkenberg, 6 Perez.
2018-07-22T14:42:06Z: Grosjean passes Ericsson now to claim eighth.
2018-07-22T14:41:35Z: Slow lap for Bottas, and Raikkonen is now within DRS range of him.
2018-07-22T14:41:16Z: What did we say about Hamilton's pace? He's just put another fastest lap in! 1m15.708s. He leads Bottas by 3.7s.
2018-07-22T14:41:13Z: Sainz dumps Hartley out of the top 10, but that will be moot given Sainz's penalty.
2018-07-22T14:40:29Z: Ericsson has a go at Ocon at the hairpin but runs too deep into the corner and is re-passed on the exit
2018-07-22T14:40:13Z: Hamilton seems happy with his 2.8-second lead, and settles into a pace a couple of tenths slower than Bottas.
2018-07-22T14:40:02Z: Ten second penalty for Sainz for overtaking behind the safety car.
2018-07-22T14:39:41Z: Raikkonen can't do anything about Bottas now, it seems. The Ferrari has fallen 1.5 seconds behind.
2018-07-22T14:38:47Z: Lap 62: 1 Hamilton, 2 Bottas, 3 Raikkonen, 4 Verstappen, 5 Hulkenberg, 6 Perez.
2018-07-22T14:38:46Z: Williams confirms Sirotkin suffered a terminal oil leak during that safety car period.
2018-07-22T14:38:10Z: Replays show Alonso having an off-track moment. A messy race from the Spaniard, perhaps the messiest ever?
2018-07-22T14:37:57Z: So if Hamilton keeps it on the road, and Bottas keeps Raikkonen behind, we're not going to have a battle for the lead. Mercedes makes its position clear.
2018-07-22T14:36:30Z: Raikkonen is just 0.8s behind Bottas now. It seems Hamilton is checking out.
2018-07-22T14:36:05Z: Wow - a 1m15.7s for Hamilton, another nine tenths quicker than Bottas, who is on tyres that are 10 laps fresher. Hamilton leads by two seconds, lap 60/67.
2018-07-22T14:35:18Z: Can Bottas get back to Hamilton, or is that it for the fight at the front?
2018-07-22T14:34:50Z: Bottas lost 0.9 seconds in the final sector.
2018-07-22T14:34:34Z: Bottas lost time in the final sector, and he crosses the line 1.5s behind his team-mate. Mistake from the Finn?
2018-07-22T14:34:18Z: Raikkonen is sat behind the two Mercedes drivers waiting to pick up the pieces.
2018-07-22T14:34:04Z: Hamilton defends from Bottas into the hairpin, Bottas tries to switchback, but Hamilton defends again on the run to the Mercedes arena! These two are going at it now.
2018-07-22T14:33:14Z: Hamilton is told more rain is expected before the finish.
2018-07-22T14:33:03Z: Hamilton boots the throttle in the stadium section, with Bottas and Raikkonen on his tail.
2018-07-22T14:32:42Z: Safety car in this lap. Can Hamilton hold on with tyres 10 lap older?
2018-07-22T14:32:34Z: That leaves Ericsson and Hartley both in the points. Grosjean back up to 10th now.
2018-07-22T14:32:02Z: Sainz pits too now, so dry tyre sense has finally prevailed on the field.
2018-07-22T14:31:24Z: That has dropped both outside the top 10. Big gain for Force India - Perez now sixth and Ocon seventh.
2018-07-22T14:30:35Z: Grosjean and Magnussen have done likewise for Haas.
2018-07-22T14:30:07Z: With the track drying out behind the safety car, Hulkenberg abandons the inters and pits for ultrasofts.
2018-07-22T14:28:46Z: Big mix of strategies behind the safety car. Hulkenberg on inters, Perez and Ocon on well worn softs, Ericsson on reasonably old ultras, then Sainz, Grosjean and Magnussen on inters, with Hartley and Vandoorne on fresh ultras!
2018-07-22T14:28:10Z: Hamilton asks if the guys behind him (Bottas, Raikkonen, Verstappen) have new tyres. They do.
2018-07-22T14:25:53Z: Sirotkin has pulled off the track and is out.
2018-07-22T14:25:29Z: Order behind the safety car: 1 Hamilton, 2 Bottas, 3 Raikkonen, 4 Verstappen, 5 Hulkenberg, 6 Perez.
2018-07-22T14:25:01Z: Vettel trudges back through the paddock, surrounded by TV cameras.
2018-07-22T14:24:42Z: Raikkonen comes in from second - Hamilton now leads!
2018-07-22T14:24:23Z: Verstappen has also pitted for ultrasofts under this safety car.
2018-07-22T14:23:58Z: Hamilton went towards the pitlane, then took to the grass between the pit entry and the race track to stay out.
2018-07-22T14:23:49Z: Mass rush for the pits. Hulkenberg, Magnussen, Grosjean and Sirotkin have all come in for inters.
2018-07-22T14:23:28Z: Vettel climbs out of his car, having slid straight on in the stadium section and bounced through the gravel into the tyre wall.
2018-07-22T14:22:38Z: Bottas has pitted, but Mercedes doesn't have tyres ready!
2018-07-22T14:22:22Z: Safety car for the crashed race leader.
2018-07-22T14:22:11Z: Disaster for Vettel on home soil!
2018-07-22T14:22:04Z: The Ferrari is in the barriers!
2018-07-22T14:21:37Z: Hamilton is only 11 seconds off the lead now, on ultrasofts chasing the leaders all on old softs.
2018-07-22T14:20:56Z: Hulkenberg went off the road too.
2018-07-22T14:20:22Z: Leclerc has gone off just before the Parabolica. Looks as though the conditions have worsened dramatically again.
2018-07-22T14:20:02Z: Bottas is right on Raikkonen's tail for second as they catch a huge group of backmarkers on the wet part of the circuit!
2018-07-22T14:19:34Z: Leclerc we love your style! What a great catch👌 @SauberF1Team #GermanGP
2018-07-22T14:18:44Z: Replays show a massive 360-degree spin for Leclerc coming through Turn 1!
2018-07-22T14:18:18Z: Lap 50: 1 Vettel, 2 Raikkonen, 3 Bottas, 4 Hamilton, 5 Verstappen, 6 Magnussen.
2018-07-22T14:18:07Z: Alonso gives up too now. Used softs for the McLaren. Leclerc, Alonso and Gasly have dropped to the back after that failed roll of the dice.
2018-07-22T14:17:46Z: Vettel is told about the intermediate runners coming back in for slicks.
2018-07-22T14:17:26Z: Verstappen is back in the pits, ditching his intermediates for ultrasofts.
2018-07-22T14:17:15Z: Gasly abandons his attempt on wets too, having skated through the gravel at the stadium.
2018-07-22T14:16:41Z: Leclerc back in for ultras now. That inter gamble has failed.
2018-07-22T14:16:14Z: Hulkenberg has taken advantage of the tricky conditions to close right in on Magnussen in the battle for sixth.
2018-07-22T14:15:23Z: Vettel has lost a small piece of his front wing at the last corner after rattling over a kerb.
2018-07-22T14:15:01Z: The pace of the slick runners has dropped by 2.5-3 seconds, nothing major yet.
2018-07-22T14:14:40Z: Verstappen has such a big gap to the Class B runners that it's worth Red Bull taking a punt, but the rest of the track isn't wet enough elsewhere yet.
2018-07-22T14:14:39Z: Leclerc is almost 10s off the pace on his first flying lap on those inters. He needs the rain to intensify soon.
2018-07-22T14:14:09Z: Verstappen gambles with a stop for intermediates!
2018-07-22T14:13:57Z: Parts of the circuit are still bathed in sunshine.
2018-07-22T14:12:40Z: Another personal best for Hamilton on his ultrasofts.
2018-07-22T14:12:28Z: Verstappen has been straight on at the hairpin, where it's wettest.
2018-07-22T14:12:11Z: Vettel leads Raikkonen by 3.3 seconds. Hamilton is 21s down in fifth following his stop.
2018-07-22T14:11:56Z: Leclerc blinks first and takes on intermediates as the rain arrives. Alonso has done the same. Gasly has taken on full wets.
2018-07-22T14:11:50Z: Hamilton's first flying lap - which includes driving through that rain at the hairpin - is a personal best. So the track is still quick.
2018-07-22T14:10:58Z: There is nothing 'light' about that rain at the far end of the track.
2018-07-22T14:10:56Z: It should be noted that Vandoorne is still running at the tail of the field. So much for 'needing to retire the car'...
2018-07-22T14:10:35Z: It's definitely raining at the hairpin now!
2018-07-22T14:10:24Z: Lap 44: 1 Vettel, 2 Raikkonen, 3 Bottas, 4 Verstappen, 5 Hamilton, 6 Magnussen.
2018-07-22T14:10:00Z: Ericsson makes use of those fresh tyres to overtake Gasly for 14th.
2018-07-22T14:09:12Z: Hamilton rejoins in fifth on ultrasofts, having run out of tyres to hang on for the rain everybody is talking about.
2018-07-22T14:08:23Z: Hamilton is called into the pits for his first stop of the race.
2018-07-22T14:07:57Z: Ocon has finally found a way past his former friend Gasly to take 12th place for Force India.
2018-07-22T14:07:44Z: Depending on which radio channel you listen to, it'll rain at some point. Mercedes tells Bottas eight minutes, then two minutes later Red Bull tells Verstappen it'll be 10 minutes.
2018-07-22T14:07:15Z: Vettel already leads Raikkonen by 2.5 seconds. Hamilton is a further 3.8s back.
2018-07-22T14:05:43Z: Ericsson finally pits and takes on new ultrasoft tyres. A chance for the Sauber man to make a charge up from 15th now.
2018-07-22T14:03:35Z: Lap 39: 1 Raikkonen, 2 Vettel, 3 Hamilton, 4 Bottas, 5 Verstappen, 6 Magnussen.
2018-07-22T14:01:58Z: Ocon is all over Gasly now in the battle for 13th place.
2018-07-22T14:01:53Z: Hamilton still hasn't pitted - he's five seconds off the lead.
2018-07-22T14:00:29Z: Alonso has a look at passing Ocon into the hairpin but isn't quite close enough to overtake on the brakes.
2018-07-22T14:00:06Z: Vettel is now just 0.4s behind Raikkonen, perhaps the switch is coming?
2018-07-22T14:00:00Z: McLaren mechanics are waiting in the pits to receive their ailing car.
2018-07-22T13:59:40Z: Last man Vandoorne is trundling slowly around the circuit.
2018-07-22T13:59:08Z: Massive lockup from Gasly at the hairpin in front of the leaders.
2018-07-22T13:57:08Z: Lap 34: 1 Raikkonen, 2 Vettel, 3 Hamilton, 4 Bottas, 5 Verstappen, 6 Magnussen.
2018-07-22T13:55:54Z: Replays show Alonso locking up in the stadium. His tyres looked shot. Was probably hanging on for rain that hasn't arrived yet.
2018-07-22T13:55:18Z: Having lost those places in short order, Alonso heads for the pits finally.
2018-07-22T13:54:51Z: 0.8 seconds between Raikkonen and Vettel at the moment at the front of the field.
2018-07-22T13:54:35Z: Magnussen and Hulkenberg both pass Alonso and are up to sixth and seventh now. Replays show Alonso almost colliding with the Haas on the exit of the Turn 6 hairpin.
2018-07-22T13:53:24Z: Fastest lap for Bottas - 1m16.9s for the man in fourth.
2018-07-22T13:53:20Z: Further back, Grosjean clears Ericsson and is back up to ninth now. Perez clears the Sauber shortly afterwards and is now back into the top 10.
2018-07-22T13:53:12Z: Raikkonen has been told that Vettel is behind him on fresher tyres - but last time around Raikkonen was four tenths quicker than his team-mate.
2018-07-22T13:52:43Z: Magnussen has closed up to within a second of the long-running Alonso now in the battle for sixth.
2018-07-22T13:52:28Z: Lap 30: 1 Raikkonen, 2 Vettel, 3 Hamilton, 4 Bottas, 5 Verstappen, 6 Alonso.
2018-07-22T13:52:06Z: Verstappen pits from the temporary race lead, also taking softs. Raikkonen now leads from Vettel.
2018-07-22T13:51:24Z: Red Bull asks Ricciardo to stop the car and pull off the circuit near a gap in the barriers.
2018-07-22T13:50:15Z: Bottas pits from the lead, taking softs.
2018-07-22T13:49:03Z: Replays show Leclerc's Sauber finally clearing the slower Williams of Sirotkin at the Turn 6 hairpin.
2018-07-22T13:48:13Z: Alonso and Ericsson are the two midfield contenders still running long in this first stint.
2018-07-22T13:47:34Z: Ocon finally makes his pitstop and drops to the back after taking on new softs.
2018-07-22T13:47:18Z: Bottas now leads from Verstappen, with Raikkonen 2.4s ahead of Vettel thanks to stopping earlier.
2018-07-22T13:46:55Z: Vettel rejoins on fresh softs, between Raikkonen and Hamilton. It should be pretty straightforward for Vettel to get away from Hamilton here, as his tyres are 25 laps fresher.
2018-07-22T13:46:11Z: Vettel pits, as we get a replay of him locking up at the Mercedes arena.
2018-07-22T13:45:08Z: Replays show a very slow stop for Perez. Problem with the front right wheel.
2018-07-22T13:44:45Z: Lap 24: 1 Vettel 2 Bottas, 3 Verstappen, 4 Raikkonen, 5 Hamilton, 6 Ricciardo.
2018-07-22T13:44:33Z: Grosjean is past Stroll now and Ocon follows him through at the Turn 6 hairpin. Sainz has a look into 7 but has to back out.
2018-07-22T13:44:06Z: The top four haven't been this close for quite some time.
2018-07-22T13:43:31Z: Sainz was passing Hartley's Toro Rosso and Grosjean checked up ahead as Stroll was slow off the corner.
2018-07-22T13:43:03Z: Sainz almost rear-ends Grosjean at the hairpin.
2018-07-22T13:42:39Z: Renault tells Hulkenberg it isn't crucial to clear these slower longer running cars ahead quickly.
2018-07-22T13:42:08Z: Grosjean in for mediums too now. He'll be relieved having struggled with the tyres so far.
2018-07-22T13:41:23Z: Magnussen rejoins on mediums just ahead of Ericsson, and passes Ocon on the outlap to put two cars between the Haas and Hulkenberg's Renault.
2018-07-22T13:40:37Z: Haas responds to Hulkenberg's stop. Magnussen is in for new tyres too now, as are Sainz and Leclerc.
2018-07-22T13:40:13Z: Vettel's lead over Bottas is now 4.6 seconds, and as things stand Bottas would rejoin from a pitstop behind Raikkonen. But if it stays dry the Ferrari will surely have to two-stop, so perhaps Mercedes thinks the best thing to do is go as long as possible on this stint and assume Raikkonen will be taken out of the equation later on.
2018-07-22T13:39:46Z: Replays show Leclerc trying to fight back against Ricciardo but the Sauber man has to settle into 11th.
2018-07-22T13:38:58Z: Ricciardo up into the top 10 now after diving past Leclerc at Turn 8.
2018-07-22T13:38:41Z: Raikkonen asks if he needs to look after the left rear, but he's told it's fine as things are.
2018-07-22T13:38:13Z: Hulkenberg pits from sixth place and takes on mediums.
2018-07-22T13:37:13Z: Lap 19: 1 Vettel, 2 Bottas, 3 Verstappen, 4 Raikkonen (1 stop), 5 Hamilton, 6 Magnussen.
2018-07-22T13:36:46Z: Scratch that! Ricciardo gets a bit closer coming out of the Parabolica and dives inside Alonso with a trademark late lunge on the brakes at the Turn 6 hairpin. Alonso half-heartedly tries to fight back to no avail.
2018-07-22T13:35:50Z: Fastest lap for Raikkonen on those fresh tyres - 1m17.581s. He's 12 seconds behind Verstappen, and pulling away from Hamilton behind.
2018-07-22T13:35:04Z: Ricciardo seems to have run out of steam in terms of his charge up the order. His best bet now looks to be to wait for the cars ahead to pit out of his way when their softer tyres give up the ghost.
2018-07-22T13:33:53Z: Replays show Alonso having a big lunge at Leclerc at the hairpin, getting it wrong, but somehow surviving and still emerging ahead of Ricciardo.
2018-07-22T13:32:43Z: So, is that Ferrari trying to force Mercedes into an early stop for Bottas? Then again, he's rejoined just in front of Hamilton, so perhaps Ferrari was covering off the other Silver Arrow.
2018-07-22T13:31:56Z: Raikkonen pits from third place to take softs, and it's a slightly slow stop.
2018-07-22T13:31:40Z: Hamilton breezes past Magnussen to take fifth.
2018-07-22T13:31:02Z: Grosjean has to get defensive as Sainz attacks coming into the stadium section. The Haas stays eighth for now.
2018-07-22T13:29:43Z: Bottas has pegged Vettel's lead at 3.5s for the last couple of laps. Or it could be that Vettel has considered that to be enough of a buffer and has pegged it for himself.
2018-07-22T13:29:27Z: Ricciardo has slipstreamed up to the back of the similarly Renault-powered McLaren of Alonso. 12th place in Ricciardo's sights now.
2018-07-22T13:28:25Z: Lap 12: 1 Vettel, 2 Bottas, 3 Raikkonen, 4 Verstappen, 5 Magnussen, 6 Hamilton.
2018-07-22T13:27:34Z: Hamilton is past the Renault now too and up into the top six.
2018-07-22T13:27:04Z: Hamilton told to keep and eye on his tyre temperatures as Hulkenberg reports blistering of his Renault's tyres.
2018-07-22T13:26:37Z: Ricciardo is past Ocon now and up to 13th in the Red Bull.
2018-07-22T13:26:18Z: Hamilton is making smooth progress but he is already more than 23s off the lead.
2018-07-22T13:26:04Z: Verstappen asks for an update on the wind direction in sectors two and three.
2018-07-22T13:25:35Z: Ricciardo is now up to 14th after diving inside Ericsson's Sauber.
2018-07-22T13:25:18Z: Vettel leads by 3.8 seconds at the end of lap nine, ahead of Bottas. Raikkonen is +5.2s, Verstappen +7.0s.
2018-07-22T13:24:02Z: Hamilton makes it easily past Grosjean at the hairpin. That's eighth now for the Mercedes driver.
2018-07-22T13:22:52Z: Vettel is now 3.2s clear of Bottas as we start lap eight. Looking comfortable.
2018-07-22T13:22:42Z: And then Perez picks the Haas off at the hairpin as Grosjean locks up under braking.
2018-07-22T13:22:03Z: Ricciardo is past Sirotkin now and up to 15th, though is struggling to get his mediums up to temperature.
2018-07-22T13:21:52Z: Lap 7: 1 Vettel, 2 Bottas, 3 Raikkonen, 4 Verstappen, 5 Magnussen, 6 Hulkenberg.
2018-07-22T13:21:16Z: Hamilton up to ninth now, picking off Sainz at the hairpin in a carbon copy of the Leclerc pass.
2018-07-22T13:20:04Z: Ricciardo is up to 16th now, having passed Hartley and Stroll.
2018-07-22T13:19:45Z: Replays show Hamilton made a very neat pass around the outside of Sirotkin in the stadium on lap one. Tight stuff, but he made it stick!
2018-07-22T13:18:39Z: Hamilton makes a straightforward DRS pass on Leclerc at the hairpin. He's up into the points now.
2018-07-22T13:18:26Z: Fastest lap for Vettel - 1m17.777s. He leads by 2.3s from Bottas.
2018-07-22T13:17:27Z: Hamilton grabs 11th from Alonso's McLaren, lunging down the inside at Turn 8.
2018-07-22T13:16:45Z: All pretty calm at the front already - Vettel leads Bottas by 1.7s, with Raikkonen 3.2s off the lead, and Verstappen 4.6s back.
2018-07-22T13:16:36Z: Ricciardo passes Gasly to move up to 18th.
2018-07-22T13:16:01Z: 1 Vettel, 2 Bottas, 3 Raikkonen, 4 Verstappen, 5 Magnussen, 6 Hulkenberg, 7 Grosjean, 8 Perez, 9 Sainz, 10 Leclerc.
2018-07-22T13:15:54Z: Ricciardo is only 19th - ahead of only Vandoorne's McLaren.
2018-07-22T13:15:18Z: Hamilton passes Ocon at Turn 1 at the start of lap two.
2018-07-22T13:15:01Z: Magnussen has held fifth while Grosjean survives a three-wide moment at the hairpin to hold seventh from Perez and Sainz.
2018-07-22T13:14:54Z: Vettel leads by 1.1 seconds at the end of the opening lap. Raikkonen, Verstappen, Magnussen, Hulkenberg, completes the top six.
2018-07-22T13:14:25Z: Verstappen gets alongside Raikkonen again on the run to the hairpin, but he's on the outside and can't get through still. He attacks again into the Mercedes arena but the Ferrari continues to fend him off, allowing Vettel and Bottas to get away.
2018-07-22T13:14:09Z: Grosjean runs wide at Turn 1, which allows Hulkenberg a run.
2018-07-22T13:13:40Z: Clean at the front, Bottas slots in between the Ferraris, and Verstappen had a look at Raikkonen into Turn 1 but couldn't make it stick.
2018-07-22T13:12:33Z: Vettel leads the field round the final two corners and onto the grid.
2018-07-22T13:10:20Z: The field sets off for the formation lap.
2018-07-22T13:09:30Z: The top 10 will all start on the used ultrasoft tyres they ran in Q2. Ocon has gone for new ultrasofts. Alonso, Sirotkin, Ericsson, Hamilton, Hartley, Stroll, Vandoorne and Gasly have opted to start the race on softs. Ricciardo has gone for mediums, so expect a long first stint from him.
2018-07-22T13:03:58Z: Gasly is the big loser overnight as regards the grid. Honda has decided to increase his pool of available engine parts by swapping the power unit overnight, so he drops to the back row of the grid alongside Ricciardo. Toro Rosso failed to escape Q1 in qualifying, so the damage is minimal given Gasly would have started 16th at best anyway. Pierre Gasly takes engine grid penalty for F1 German Grand PrixPierre Gasly is set to join Daniel Ricciardo on the back row of the German GP grid after Honda opted to change most of his power unit components for the race
2018-07-22T13:01:50Z: Starting grid: 1 Vettel, 2 Bottas, 3 Raikkonen, 4 Verstappen, 5 Magnussen, 6 Grosjean, 7 Hulkenberg, 8 Sainz, 9 Leclerc, 10 Perez, 11 Alonso, 12 Sirotkin, 13 Ericsson, 14 Hamilton, 15 Ocon, 16 Hartley, 17 Stroll, 18 Vandoorne, 19 Ricciardo, 20 Gasly.
2018-07-22T12:59:43Z: Championship leader Vettel has pole position for his home race, and the added bonus of chief title rival Hamilton starting way down in 14th. This could be a big race for the momentum of the title fight.
2018-07-22T12:58:07Z: But there is the threat of rain hanging over the race - the FIA is reporting a 60% chance and a possible thunderstorm.
2018-07-22T12:57:25Z: We had a wet start on Saturday, but it's sweltering hot at Hockenheim as F1 gets ready to rumble in just over 10 minutes time.
2018-07-22T12:56:27Z: Not long now until it's time to start the race.
2018-07-22T12:56:11Z: Welcome back to our live coverage of the German Grand Prix.
